results.title: The Greeks in search of meaning
results.creator_credit: John H. Secondari and Helen Jean Secondari
results.brief_description: Recreates the concerns and achievements of the Greeks in the 5th century B.C. Eternal philosophical and moral debates are dramatised through the dialogues of the era’s great thinkers. Includes excerpts from Antigone by Sophocles, and Lysistrata by Aristophanes.

results.title: The Greedy frog
results.creator_credit: Kate White Productions, South Australian Government (Film and Television Financing Fund), Kate White and Murray Lomax
results.brief_description: This aboriginal dreamtime story of The Greedy Frog is told using footage of Australian animals in the wild. Suitable for children the story tells of The Greedy Frog who drank all the water in the billabong leaving the plants and all the animals in the area without water. The koala wants to fix the situation and decides the solution is to make the frog laugh. After enlisting the help of all the other animals it is the Old Man Emu that finally saves the day.

results.title: The Greatest story untold
results.brief_description: A short animation using both 3D claymation and 2D hand-drawn animation. A caveman wanders through the snow back to his cave and family after a hunt to find his family telling their dreams of the future. The stories differ with visions of our contemporary life, aliens kidnapping humans, and battles between good and evil.

results.title: The Greatest story ever told
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and George Stevens
results.brief_description: With one of the finest film casts ever assembled, this epic has been hailed as the definitive screen version of the life and times of Jesus Christ. As Jesus, the internationally acclaimed Max Von Sydow reveals the compassion, anguish and glory of the “King of the Jews” in the performance of a lifetime. The distinguished ensemble cast also features Charlton Heston as John the Baptist, Jose Ferrer as King Herrod, John Wayne as the Centurion, Sidney Poitier as Simon of Cyrene, Telly Savalas as Pontius Pilate and Angela Lansbury as Claudia. Combining stellar performances, lavish sets, stunning locations and costing in excess of $20 million dollars, the story is true to the pages of the Gospel, earning five Academy Award nominations to become an enduring and revered classic.

results.title: The Greatest show on Earth
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: Cecil B. DeMille blended drama with spectacle, using the Ringling Bros. Barnum & Bailey Circus as a backdrop. The film is a behind-the- scenes look at the triumphs and conflicts of circus performers. The magic and thrill of life under the Big Top is stunningly recreated. The all-star cast includes Betty Hutton, Cornel Wilde, Charlton Heston, Dorothy Lamour and James Stewart as “Buttons the Clown”. Filled with romance, intrigue and high-flying acrobatics, “The Greatest Show on Earth” is exactly that.

results.title: The Greatest run on earth
results.creator_credit: Pillsbury Films, Television New Zealand and Sam Pillsbury
results.brief_description: Why does an entire city suddenly go crazy on running? In the land where jogging was ‘invented’ by Arthur Lydiard twenty years ago, a film crew looked closely at how the city of Auckland, population a mere 500,000 is convulsed by preparations for this bizarre annual event, ‘the greatest run on earth’.

results.title: The Greatest man in the world
results.creator_credit: Learning in Focus, Ed Lynch and Ralph Rosenblum
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
An adaptation of a James Thurber story featuring Brad Davis, Carol Kane and Howard da Silva. The first man to fly solo and non-stop around the world is an illiterate and incorrigible lout. Attempts by newsmen and high government officials to present him as a hero fail dismally. Teleplay by Jeff Wanshel. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The Greatest game on earth
results.creator_credit: Melbourne Repertory Film Unit, Australian National Football Council, Roland Beckett and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: Ricky, who has recently arrived in Australia, sees his first game of Australian Rules Football when he follows the boys of his neighbourhood to the Melbourne Cricket Ground where Geelong is playing Collingwood. At first the atmosphere is strange and new, but the boy soon becomes a part of the enthusiastic crowd excited by the fast field play, high punt kicks, snap shots for goal and clever manoeuvres which comprise Australia’s national sport.

results.title: The Greatest gamble
results.brief_description: Christopher Brasher assesses the gambles taken in supporting new inventions and introduces some of the men involved. Includes the trials of the Dr Barnes Wallis swing wing aircraft, and Professor F. C. Williams of Manchester University relives the moment when he saw the way of solving the problems of electronic memory. Other contributors includes Christopher Cockerell who discusses hovercraft, Geoffrey Stockdale on the take-apart ship and Donald Firth on the revolution in cars and machine tools.
